He recalls receiving a book that Henry Kissinger had written, with the inscription, To an occasional adversary and a permanent friend. Working on the book meant second-guessing his memory. In a new interview with Oprah Winfrey , Simon Cowell admitted he wanted to quit while he was still at the top of his game. I asked a successful guy, "What's the best advice you can give me?' He said,` Simon Cowell , know when to leave the fair'. I think that's good advice- one year, I actually found myself thinking,` I've run out of insults, I don't know how I'm going to tell people they suck'. "Something inside you just says,` You know what, it's time to go', Simon Cowell added. "Without any regrets. I can look back on the past 10 years and say it's been a blast. I've enjoyed myself. I mean, it"s not the most difficult job
